column1: Sanger Sample ID from Sample Manifest; can be left empty if Sample Manifest has not yet been generated
column2: Your sample name, no hyphens please, underscores are accepted
column3: Sample name in accordance with project's sample naming convention
column4: This will be completed by Sanger once samples are sequenced
column5: Study name if isolates taken from defined in-country study
column6: Pubmed ID (PMID) for article describing the study if available
column7: Was isolate selected randomly? Options: yes/no
column9: County/state where isolate was collected if known
column10: City where isolate was collected if known
column15: Options: human, bovine, fish, camel, other (enter species name if known)
column17: Options: neonate, infant, child, adolescent, adult. For reference please check the 'Age classification' tab
column22: Options: carriage, invasive disease, non-invasive disease
column23: For options please refer to 'Entry values' tab; if carriage sample, please enter 'NA'
column24: For neonatal/infant disease only; options: EOD, LOD, VLOD; If other disease or carriage please enter 'NA'
column25: Sample isolation source/site; for options please refer to 'Entry values' tab
column26: Options: Ia, Ib, II, III, IV, V, VI, VII, VIII, IX, NT
column27: Method used to determine serotype; Options: latex agglutination, Lancefield, PCR, other
column28: For maternal carriage isolates only; Options: yes, no
column29: For maternal carriage isolates only; for Options please refer to 'Entry values' tab
column30: For maternal carriage or neonatal carriage/disease isolates only
